required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy of Simulation Manikins in the Military Medics Training
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy of Simulation Manikins in the Military Medics Training

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to verify the applicability of simulation manikin in combat training of military medics. The research will be conducted on healthy volunteers - medics of the Czech Armed Forces, as a part of the compulsory medical courses required for foreign military missions as a "Combat Life Saver". Comparison of the performance of two groups of course participants who were trained using the standard approach versus experiential learning using simulation manikins.

detailed_description.textblock: With the development of modern hi-tech manikins and their growing popularity in the training of "civilian" medics, the possibilities of their application in the training of military medics are emerging. The aim of the study is to verify the applicability of simulation manikin in combat training of military medics. The research will be conducted on healthy volunteers - medics of the Czech Armed Forces, as a part of the compulsory medical courses required for foreign military missions as a "Combat Life Saver". Comparison of the performance of two groups of course participants who were trained using the standard approach versus experiential learning using simulation manikins. In addition to monitoring the particular professional performance of the trainees, changes in basic physiological functions, including the endocrinological response to stress conditions, will be evaluated.

primary_outcome.measure: Duration time of the of use of tourniquet
primary_outcome.description: Time to complete diagnostics and treatment of bleeding (in seconds)

primary_outcome.measure: Correctness of treatment of severe bleeding
primary_outcome.description: Based on standardized forms (points on a standardised scale)

primary_outcome.measure: Duration time of the of use of nasal airway
primary_outcome.description: Time to complete diagnostics and treatment of airway obstruction (in seconds)

primary_outcome.measure: Correctness of treatment of airway obstruction
primary_outcome.description: Based on standardized forms (points on a standardised scale)

primary_outcome.measure: Duration time of the use of chest seal
primary_outcome.description: Time to complete diagnostics and treatment of open pneumothorax (in seconds)

primary_outcome.measure: Correctness of treatment of open pneumothorax
primary_outcome.description: Based on standardized forms (points on a standardised scale)

secondary_outcome.description: Level of stress response based on changes in blood pressure (in mm of mercury)
Level of stress response based on changes in heart rate (in beats per minute)
Level of stress response based on changes in cortisol level (in nmol/L)

arm_group.description: Combat Life Savers trained by conventional combat medicine approach.
Training based on principles of simulation medicine.

intervention.description: Two approaches to training Combat Life Savers will be employed and performance of participants will be evaluated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- active soldier during the Tactical Combat Casualty Care course
Exclusion Criteria:
- not willing to participate

reference.citation: McCarthy M. US military revamps combat medic training and care. Lancet. 2003 Feb 8;361(9356):494-5. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(03)12494-4. No abstract available.
